text: Baruch College, Zicklin School of Business
description: While a Master's in Business Analytics is relevant, its presentation is weak for a Senior Software Engineer role. The CV should emphasize the technical aspects of the degree, specifically the programming and data engineering skills acquired. It should include specific projects and technologies used within the program.

A BS in Fashion Business Management is not directly relevant to a Senior Software Engineer role. While it might demonstrate transferable skills, it occupies valuable space that could be used to highlight more relevant technical experience or projects. If included, a very brief mention is sufficient, focusing on any data analysis or problem-solving aspects relevant to software engineering.

The description of this project is weak. While it mentions tools like Python, Pandas, Matplotlib, and Seaborn, it doesn't quantify the impact or complexity of the work. A Senior Software Engineer role requires demonstrating the ability to design and implement complex solutions. It should be enhanced with quantifiable achievements and details about the problem solved and the solution's architecture.

text: Stock Price Pipeline and Visualization for E-Commerce:
description: This project description needs more detail, especially concerning the AWS infrastructure used. It mentions AWS and Python but lacks specifics about the design, scalability, and reliability of the data pipeline. For a Senior role, it should detail the architectural choices, data processing techniques, and performance optimization strategies employed.

The description of this project is too high-level. For a Senior Software Engineer role, it needs to go deeper into the technical details. How was the data cleaned and transformed? What specific algorithms or techniques were used for analysis? What were the limitations of the analysis? Were there any challenges faced and how were they overcome?

This project description is weak and more suited to a business analyst than a software engineer. It lacks technical depth. A senior software engineer's portfolio should showcase code quality, architecture, and system design, aspects currently missing. The project's focus should shift towards demonstrating relevant coding and software development skills, rather than purely business analysis insights.

The Operation Analyst role at Watchfinder&Co is not directly relevant to a Senior Software Engineer position. While transferable skills may exist, the description focuses on data inspection and processing rather than software development or engineering. The descriptions that follow need to emphasize any programming or scripting skills used, any automation of processes, or any integration of systems.

The Merchandising & Marketing Coordinator role at Yigal Azrouel is not relevant to a Senior Software Engineer position. This experience should be significantly condensed or omitted unless there were specific technical responsibilities that can be highlighted. As written, it takes up valuable space that could showcase more relevant skills and experience.

text: Coordinating transformative events and workshops as a committee member at AMA, Baruch College, to foster personal growth
description: While leadership and extracurricular activities are valuable, the description is vague and doesn't highlight skills relevant to a Senior Software Engineer role. This section should be concise, and if possible, reframe activities to showcase skills like teamwork, problem-solving, or communication in a technical context. Alternatively, prioritize technical projects and experience.
